resources.string: Haven\'t linked to dropbox -> Link to Dropbox
Already linked to dropbox -> Switch Accounts

"You must first unlink the current linked account to switch to another account.

" + "You can still use this app offline with any account already signed in.

" + "Unlink an account offline will cause you not to be able to log into any account resulting in this App being not applicable!

" + "Yes to unlink the current account and proceed to swtich accounts, No to cancel."
Please wait while the speech is being analyzed.

"1. allow [child] to choose <noisy words> from selection
" "2. parents completed <noisy words> previous assignment
" "3. begins <noisy words> associative play
" "4. [CDP] ([[and][reviewed today's family play group]]| [[and] [invite mom to upcoming play group]])+
" "5. [CDP] [will] encourage associative play [through|via] animated demonstration [and purposeful play]
" "6. Encourage more book (exploration | reading) <noisy words> during the week
" "7. ((Start talking)|talk) about safety proofing in mom's parents' home
" "8. [They have] read <#one-ten> times together this week
" "9. Replaces <noisy words> some objects where <noisy words> they belong
" "10. Come to group at least once before (the program|this|the) year ends
" "11. Put the toys back to their original places
" "12. Come to group with [the] kids"

string-array.name: text_array
string-array.item: 4; [CDP] ([[and][reviewed today\'s family play group]]| [[and] [invite mom to upcoming play group]])+
5; [CDP] [will] encourage associative play [through|via] animated demonstration [and purposeful play]
6; encourage more book (exploration | reading) during the week
7; [start talking] talk about safety proofing in mom\'s parents\' home
8; [they have] read # times together this week
9; replaces some objects where they belong
10; come to group at least once before (the program|this|the) year ends
11; put the toys back to their original places

resources.string: Is either parent/guadian an active member of the Military(Who)
Do you receive child care subsidy?
Is this child in Foster or Kin Care
Are there any written custody arrangements?
Are there pets in the home?
# of Years Parent in HS/EHS program
Does child receive any special services? (MH, IEP, TSS, etc.)
Date of Start of Year Assessment
Date of End of Year Assessment
"For each statement in this assessment, give a response of 1, 2 or 3 indicating how " "you feel the statement fits you: 1 is “yes”, 2 is “not sure” or “sometimes”, and 3 is “no”."
I am confident that my parenting skills are effective
I am able to meet my child\'s needs
I know how to soothe my child when he/she is upset
I avoid using physical punishment when my child does something wrong
I realize my child may not always do as I say
I spend special time with my child doing things that he/she enjoys
How would you describe your relationship with your child(ren)?
What is the most difficult part of parenting for you?
I understand that my child\'s behavior has meaning
I allow my child to learn by exploring the environment
We have family rules and daily routines that we follow
I create activities at home to support my child\'s learning
I understand the importance of developing a positive relationship with my child\'s teacher
What are your hopes for your child\'s future?
What do you hope your child will learn while in Head Start/Early Head Start?
FAMILY CONNECTIONS TO PEERS AND COMMUNITY
I have family members and/or friends who I can ask for help when I need it.
My child spends time playing with other children.
"I have a positive relationship with my neighbors.
I like exploring my community with my family - i.e. library, festivals, and parks.
I participate in community groups such as church, neighborhood watch, etc.
I utilize other agency supports/services when I need to.
I have someone to care for my child when needed.
I feel my children access to quality, affordable child care.
If you have utilized other agency supports/services, please describe the service and how it helped your family.
How would you describe your family, your friends, and your community?
I feel safe in my home and community.
I am satisfied with my current living situation.
My home is safe and in good physical condition.
I am able to meet basic needs such as food and housing
I pay my bills regularly and on time
I am satisfied with my current employment status.
My family health needs are met.
I know how to plan nutritious family meals.
>I feel safe in my closest relationships.
I am able to cope with the daily frustrations of life
Of all of the questions you answered with a 2 or 3, which is the greatest concern for you?
I know how to advocate for what is best for my child and family.
I know how important it is to participate in Parent-Teacher Conferences and/or Home Visits.
I am a leader in a community group - such as church, PTA, etc.
I am comfortable talking in a large group.
I am able to research information to support my family\'s needs.
I believe I have a voice and can change my community.
I look for opportunities to better myself and my family.
What do you hope to accomplish for yourself while your child is enrolled in Early Head Start/Head Start?
My child has crayons, pencils, and paper available for writing and drawing.
My child has access to at least 10 picture books.
I read a picture book with my child at least four times a week.
I have detailed and informative conversations with my child.
My child sees me reading books, magazines or the newspaper at home.
I am a good reader and feel comfortable reading aloud to my child.
I expect that my child will work to his or her potential in school.
If you have introduced your child to the alphabet, please describe what you have done to support alphabetic awareness.
Do you have a library card? If so, how often do you and your child visit the library and what services do you use?
"\nThe parent and I decided that for our next visit:"
"\nParent's description of how he(she) used the SMART Action Step since our last visit" "\n(\"What Action Step used? How did it go? What worked? What was difficult?\")"
"\nPlease describe why you and the parent decided to continue or change the SMART Action Step:"
"\nNew SMART Action Step Planning with Parent"

"
"What will you do to get to your goal?"" "

**Only complete if a new SMART Action Step will be developed this home visit**" "


Our new SMART Action Step"
"\nRecord your Action Step that is:" "\nSpecific (Who? What? Where?) and Timely (When?)"

"
Evaluate the New SMART Action Step" "

How do you know that this Action Step is:" "
Measurable (Indicators of Progress), Attainable, and Realistic"

"
Record of Progress Toward meeting Goal" "

Parent's view of the progress toward meeting the SMART Goal:"

string-array.name: view_levels
string-array.item: 0: Moving much further from meeting Goal
2: No change in progress toward Goal
4: Moving much closer to meeting Goal

resources.string: "\nWill you and the parent continue to work on the same SMART Goal?"
"\nIf no, or your first goal, select:"
"Tap here to complete:" "\nNew Smart Goal Planning with Parent"
